Climb to a optimum FL and increase your pitch.

What is the best action for the commander to take?

options.text: Once the passenger is on board, it is the Commander’s decision whether he/she travels, so the Commander should decide alone whether to offload him/her.
The Commander should tell the passenger that he/she may travel on condition that he/she accepts that NO alcohol will be served on the flight.
If the Dispatcher is requesting to offload the passenger, the Commander should assist in doing this.
If the SCCM is happy for the passenger to travel, then the Commander should allow him/her to do so.

According to ICAO Annex 6, a Take-off Alternate is an alternate aerodrome at which an aircraft would be able to...

options.text: land, should this become necessary shortly after take-off and it is not possible to use the aerodrome of departure.
take-off, if it is not possible to use the aerodrome of departure.

land, if a subsequent take-off from the destination aerodrome may become impossible or inadvisable.

An aircraft may be required to carry additional survival equipment. The range and quantity of this equipment depends on the number of persons on board and the route to be flown. What is the correct reason for carrying this additional survival equipment?

options.text: The aircraft is being operated on the areas in which search and rescue would be especially difficult.
This is required backup equipment in case the main equipment does NOT work.
The aircraft is carrying extra passengers on under a company procedure for Last Minute Changes (LMCs).
The area being flown over is designated as one in which aircraft must carry survival equipment for dropping to other aircraft.

variant.question:
Consider the European Regulations on Air Operations
 Which of the following statements correctly describes the radio communication equipment required for operations under IFR?

options.text: The radio communication equipment must be in accordance with the applicable airspace requirements and include at least two independent radio communication systems.
There must be at least one radio communication system and it must be in accordance with the applicable airspace requirements.
The radio communication equipment must be capable of one- or two-way communication, meeting the communication requirements in defined portions of airspace.
There must be at least one radio communication system and it must be in accordance with the applicable certification requirements.
